title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
message:
Hi there
I have an 820-3332-A here that is pretty much fully functional except it auto powers on when magsafe connects. Any ideas what might be the cause of this? Seems to be a common fault related to battery. apart from the battery draining fast and showing a red battery icon at about 20% I haven't noticed anything else wrong with the battery

Thanks

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
message: What does battery status indicate? Did you do a PRAM reset and powered the machine down from OSX?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
message: Shows it's charging when connected as it should. Battery health shows about 700 cycles, battery health "good"

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
[SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
message: Sorry, forgot to type, yes tried that, all the same. tried different combinations of shutting down restarting. battery disconnect etc.

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
message:
Is time and date lost after disconnecting AC and leaving it for a while. Of course do not disconnect battery.
Does it power up from just the battery without AC?

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
message:
No date and time stays, Yes powers up. I just gave it a full charge, seems fine now. Perhaps when the battery % is low, It thinks the battery is not connected at all and auto powers like it does when the battery is disconnected.

So I'm going to assume this is a battery issue

title: [SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
[SOLVED]820-3332-A    water damage, works except auto powers on when magsafe connects
message: It looks like it with a full charge! Thank you very much sir Duke!
